confession.seduction_context: Had been seduced when angry after a quarrel with her neighbour Zabey Pierron, whose cause she couldn't remember

devil_mark.description: Ordered to be shaven for 'presomption qui resulte pour le sort taciturne'

testimony.quarrel_subject: His son had been bathing in river with Barbelline's son, and latter had accused him of stealing his purse. Angry at this false accusation, witness had given Barbelline's son a beating with some 'verges'
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il rendroit ladite bourse et que ce seroit une chere bourse

witnesses.name: Jennon femme Jean Mongeot de Domjevin

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over weight of some flax which Barbelline had spun for witness

witnesses.name: Yzabel femme Didier Doyen de Domjevin

testimony.quarrel_subject: while spinning with other women 'au poisle' in winter, had sometimes got in her way, and knew no other reason for hostility

testimony.threat_quote: qu'il rendroit ladite bourse et que ce seroit une chere bourse

witnesses.name: Zabel femme Didier Pierson de Domjevin
Annel veuve Virion Bergier de Domjevin
Jehenne veuve Jean Colas de Domjevin
Bastienne femme Nicolas Simonatte de Domjevin
Jehenne fille Jean Claudon de Domjevin

testimony.quarrel_subject: mother took back a 'chaudron' they had lost during fire from Barbelline
quarrel over the sharing of some wood between his father and her husband - they had mistakenly taken some bark which should have gone to Jean Goudot

witnesses.name: Catherine fille au maire Jean Odediat of Domjevin
Barbelline fille a Colas Goudat de Domjevin
Roze veuve de feu le maire Mongenot Estienne de Domjevin

testimony.quarrel_subject: horses ate grass from a garden that Barbelline wanted to rent

witnesses.name: Eve femme Nicolas Bon Demenge de Domjevin

testimony.quarrel_subject: had seen her husband wearing a shirt which Anne's husband had lost, and told accused this. Shortly afterwards Barbelline came to her house to protest; she was so angry that she took a 'petit paillon d'airain' in which she was making 'bouillies' for her children, and gave her good beating with it, finally driving her out with 'Va t'en au diable'

witnesses.name: Catherine femme Jean Loure de Domjevin

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses, generally denied all accusations while accepting circumstantial details

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews on hands and feet, rack, and tourtillons - denied everything. Judges remarked that she was 'fort robuste'. Released after about two hours

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Hesitated and expressed fear; started to confess as soon as she was lightly pulled on the rack. Later given strappado to extract more confessions

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves, subject to confirmation of avowals without torture or sight of instruments

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Denied being a witch, said confessions had been made 'de peur de la question'

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: After consulting with priest confessor, admitted being a witch again but denied numerous articles of confession

timeline.subject: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence. Approved on same day by Change de Nancy

prior_accusations.context: More than 14 years before when the late Maire Mongenot had reproached Barbelline with causing death of his horses; to her knowledge had never sought reparation

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
notable_quotes.french: qu'il rendroit ladite bourse et que ce seroit une chere bourse
notable_quotes.english: he would return the said purse and that it would be an expensive purse
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Didier Thirion after he beat her son

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
notable_quotes.french: Oye Oye Tenez vous vous me faicts mal
notable_quotes.english: Ow ow stop you hurt me
notable_quotes.context: Seen crying bitterly by the river, speaking although no-one was near her

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot to son
notable_quotes.french: beaucoup plus prisé que le sien ad cause qu'il avoit des grands chevaulx
notable_quotes.english: much more valued than his because he had large horses
notable_quotes.context: Comment to Jean Colas's son about his foals before they died

notable_quotes.speaker: Eve femme Nicolas Bon Demenge
notable_quotes.context: Driving Barbelline out of her house after beating her

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Jean Loure's father
notable_quotes.context: Called out as Barbelline left after visiting him during his mortal illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbelline femme Jean Goudot
notable_quotes.french: qu'ouy, et qu'elle scayt bien qu'elle en a le bruict parmy la ville mais que pour cela elle n'a jamais oublié Dieu (et y a fort longtemps)
notable_quotes.english: yes, and she knows well that she has the reputation throughout the village but that despite this she has never forgotten God (and for a very long time)
notable_quotes.context: Response to being asked if she had the reputation of being a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Annel widow of Virion Bergier called by accused
notable_quotes.context: Barbelline's affectionate address during confrontations, explained as they went 'filler au poisle par ensembles' (spinning together)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne daughter-in-law
notable_quotes.french: avoit fort poeur qu'on ne luy soupconne telle chose
notable_quotes.english: had great fear that someone would suspect her of such a thing
notable_quotes.context: Jehenne Cherrier said her mother-in-law feared being suspected when bringing soup to sick child

notable_quotes.speaker: Interrogators to Barbelline
notable_quotes.french: qu'il estoit impossible qu'elle l'eut tout employée a faire mourir le bestail susdit pour estre en trop petit nombre, et que le propre du diable est d'estre liberal de choses pernitieuses et meschantes Comme de distribuer a ses ministres et personnes seduictes de la poudres, graisses, herbes, et autres choses (qui peuvent nuyre a la Creature humaine) tant qu'ilz en veullent
notable_quotes.english: that it was impossible that she had used it all to kill the aforesaid livestock for being too small in number, and that the nature of the devil is to be liberal with pernicious and wicked things such as distributing to his ministers and seduced persons powders, fats, herbs, and other things (which can harm human creatures) as much as they want
notable_quotes.context: Exhortation during torture to confess more acts

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Mengin le Xeru and his wife Allison Loure
a year older than her sister Chrestienne
Repeated contents of her mother's deposition

relationships.person1: Catherine fille au maire Jean Odediat
relationships.evidence_text: Catherine fille au maire Jean Odediat
Roze veuve de feu le maire Mongenot Estienne
Repeated essentials of story of death of two of father's horses
they went 'filler au poisle par ensembles'

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over property and resources: flax spinning payment dispute with Jennon; dispute over garden rental with maire Mongenot (horses eating grass); dispute over 'fournitures' for soldiers with Yzabel; dispute over wood sharing between fathers with Nicolas Simonatte; quarrel over lost shirt with Eve femme Nicolas Bon Demenge; recovery of lost 'chaudron' by Jean Claudon's wife

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill 'toute forcenée et troublée d'esprit' - mentally disturbed and frenzied, died after a month
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness had beaten Barbelline's son for falsely accusing his son of stealing purse
dispute over weight of some flax which Barbelline had spun for witness
harms_catalog.method_alleged: offered feed during illness which cow wouldn't eat

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: At same time as cows died
harms_catalog.method_alleged: brought egg and flour for child

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell in fire, burn on the arm, trouble using arm freely for next two years, then cured when Barbelline pulled her arm
harms_catalog.method_alleged: presence in house, later cured by pulling arm

harms_catalog.harm_description: 'toute troublée et alterée d'esprit' - mentally disturbed, died after a year
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: while spinning with other women 'au poisle' in winter, had sometimes got in her way

harms_catalog.victim_name: foals of Jean (son of Jehenne veuve Jean Colas)
harms_catalog.economic_value: Jean had saved money in service to buy them
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: jealousy - Barbelline said to the son that he would be 'beaucoup plus prisé que le sien ad cause qu'il avoit des grands chevaulx'

harms_catalog.victim_name: son of Jehenne veuve Jean Colas
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell to ground complaining of pains in body, then cured within an hour
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured by Barbelline's instructions to warm clothes by fire

harms_catalog.victim_name: mother of Jehenne fille Jean Claudon
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, believing herself bewitched, died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: mother took back a 'chaudron' they had lost during fire from Barbelline

harms_catalog.harm_description: overtaken by 'ung mauvais air' with red light and noise, struck below pourpoint, affected legs so couldn't stand, ill for 8 days, occasional pains persisted
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over sharing of wood between his father and her husband - they had mistakenly taken bark meant for Jean Goudot

harms_catalog.victim_name: two fine horses of maire Mongenot
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: horses ate grass from a garden near Barbelline's that she wanted to rent
harms_catalog.method_alleged: visited house twice during husband's absence to 'comfort' wife

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow of Eve femme Nicolas Bon Demenge
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: confrontation over stolen shirt, Eve beat Barbelline and drove her out; later Barbelline borrowed butter and leant long time against stall
harms_catalog.method_alleged: leaning against stall in stable where cow was kept

harms_catalog.victim_name: father of Catherine femme Jean Loure
harms_catalog.method_alleged: visit during illness, father called out 'Oh la meschante femme' as she left

historical_context.military_details: Soldiers billeted in village, disputes over 'fournitures' (provisions) for soldiers mentioned
economic_hardship_indicators: Jennon and husband were 'then poor' when child was sick
Jean son of Jehenne 'having saved some money in service' to buy foals

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: consulted with père confesseur while imprisoned

change_de_nancy.modification_details: First approved subject to confirmation of avowals without torture or sight of instruments (14 Jan 1604). Second approval was without modification (12 Feb 1604).

hearsay_chains.content: Had heard accusations by Jean Claudon's wife during her sickness

hearsay_chains.content: Repeated contents of her mother's deposition concerning death of brother's foals and illness of smaller brother
Repeated essentials of story of death of two of father's horses and visit to Dom Jean

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with 18 witnesses, extensive torture proceedings, confession and retraction cycle. Barbelline was tortured twice - first time resisted for 2 hours despite being 'fort robuste', second time confessed almost immediately. She later retracted, then partially reaffirmed confession after consulting priest. Execution proceeded despite inconsistent confession. Notable features: multiple property/economic disputes, suspicions spanning up to 30 years, consultation with cunning folk (conjurer at Vergaville, Dom Jean de Xanrey, femme de Hardouviller), military presence (soldier billeting), social spinning gatherings, and detailed testimony about daily interactions. The case shows pattern of minor quarrels followed by harms to humans and animals, typical accusation structure.
